alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 27 at 2:35PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM MST/330 PM MDT/ FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including Chinle in Apache County. * WHEN...Until 230 PM MST Friday /330 PM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks and normally dry washes is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 230 PM MST /330 PM MDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chinle and Navajo Reservation. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Keep children away from culverts, creeks and washes! High water levels can rapidly sweep children away. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event.
